abstract: Los Angeles City Council votes unanimously to ban high-capacity firearm magazines, namely those that can hold more than 10 rounds of ammunition.
lead_paragraph: The City Council unanimously voted on Tuesday to ban the possession of firearm magazines that can hold more than 10 rounds of ammunition, prompting calls for a legal fight by the National Rifle Association.

headline.main: Los Angeles Council Passes Ban on High-Capacity Firearm Magazines
headline.print_headline: Los Angeles Council Passes Ban on High-Capacity Firearm Magazines

snippet: The City Council unanimously voted on Tuesday to ban the possession of firearm magazines that can hold more than 10 rounds of ammunition, prompting calls for a legal fight by the National Rifle Association.
